title: latest changes to add arduino support, plus fixes for IOTSS BEID
updates and fixes to BEID updates to other cores to allow for new functionality
IAR error in command line not reported while compiling
body:
Hello,
The following command line is creating an error
build.py -v -x -c -t IAR -m DISCO_F746NG,NUCLEO_F746ZG -j 4

`[DEBUG]` Command: iasmarm --cpu Cortex-M7F -DTARGET_STM32F746NG -DTARGET_STM32F746 -DARM_MATH_CM7 -DTARGET_CORTEX_M -D__CORTEX_M7 -D__FPU_PRESENT=1 -DTARGET_DISCO_F746NG -DTARGET_RTOS_M4_M7 -DMBED_BUILD_TIMESTAMP=1456501269.49 -DTARGET_STM -DTARGET_M7 -DTARGET_STM32F7 -DTOOLCHAIN_IAR -D__MBED__=1 -I.\mbed\targets\cmsis -I.\mbed\libraries\mbed\targets\cmsis\TARGET_STM -I.\mbed\libraries\mbed\targets\cmsis\TARGET_STM\TARGET_STM32F7 -I.\mbed\libraries\mbed\targets\cmsis\
TARGET_STM\TARGET_STM32F7\TARGET_DISCO_F746NG -I.\mbed\libraries\mbed\targets\cmsis\TARGET_STM\TARGET_STM32F7\TARGET_DISCO_F746NG\TOOLCHAIN_IAR -I.\mbed\libraries\mbed\targets\cmsis\TOOLCHAIN_IAR -o .\mbed\build\mbed\.temp\TARGET_DISCO_F746NG\TOOLCHAIN_IAR\TARGET_STM\TARGET_STM32F7\TARGET_DISCO_F746NG\TOOLCHAIN_IAR\startup_stm32f746xx.o .\mbed\libraries\mbed\targets\cmsis\TARGET_STM\TARGET_STM32F7\TARGET_DISCO_F746NG\TOOLCHAIN_IAR\startup_stm32f746xx.S
[DEBUG] Return: 3
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "..\mbed\workspace_tools\build.py", line 234, in <module>
    macros=options.macros)
  File "C:\MCDGitW601\mbed\workspace_tools\build_api.py", line 445, in build_mbed_libs
    raise e
ToolException
`
I had to type the command line manually to discover that it was an option of the --cpu that was not supported:
`Error in command line: Invalid argument to option '--cpu'
`
Could you make sure this error is reported ?

Kind regards

title: [Renesas RZ/A1H] Fix analogin peripheral names
body: This fixes definitions of peripheral names in analogin_api.c

title: IAR compiles NRF51822 tests, but tests do not run
body: IAR support was removed in PR #1569, however IAR does seem to have support for NRF51822 based targets. If possible, IAR support should be added back to all of these targets.

title: [LPC15XX] Fix Clock Configuration
body:
The user manual for the LPC1549 (Table 82) says the MSEL bits should be 5, and the PSEL bits should be 1, for the correct FCCO frequency of 288MHz. The current configuration has FCCO = 144MHz, which is technically out of spec (manual-specified 156MHz ~ 320MHz).

Tested on a custom LPC1549 board with crystal oscillator running at 12MHz; 72MHz operations of system clock appears to work.

title: Target - remove cortex-m7 IAR support for 2 targets
Remove IAR from all NRF51822-based targets
body:
Removes IAR support from all NRF51822-based targets.

Currently tests do not run on NRF51822 targets when compiled with IAR. The current definition of the NRF51_DK target specifically removes IAR support in its definition. This PR unifies this removal across all of these targets.

title: Adding the ability for tests to report they aren't supported on a target
body:
This allows tests to specifically say they aren't supported on a target. This provides more info to the test suite user and to our build/CI system.

Tests that declare themselves "unsupported" should use the `#error` preprocessor directive in the following manner:

```
#if SUPPORTED
    < Do the test >
#else
    #error [NOT_SUPPORTED] This test is unsupported on this target
#endif
```

You must start the `#error` message with the prefix `[NOT_SUPPORTED]`. After that, you can add a meaningful message.

title: Update to IOTSS Beid
body:
updates and fixes to BEID
updates to other cores to allow for new functionality

title: Merge pull request #2 from mbedmicro/master
body: update from original

title: Add LPC11U35 uvision exporter support
body:
- Add LPC11U35_401 uvision exporter
- Add LPC11U35_501 uvision exporter

title: [LPC1549] Improve AnalogIn Performance
body: Modified the LPC1549 AnalogIn implementation to use the ADCs in synchronous mode, which is consistent with the LPC11U68 implementation. This improves performance, and allows the IRC oscillator to be powered down if necessary.

title: Progen data refactor
body:
The new format progen = dict() should allow to add more data used by progen.
The target can add tool flags to be overwritten by the default mbed template, or
even inject own template. This might be required for some targets. Therefore we
shall allow thiss.

I added gr-peach target . The new version of progendef will be released soon, then we can merge this. This target requires special fpu settings in IAR as I noticed, which is currently not set for this mcu, something I need to address in progendef.

@bridadan

title: fopen(filepath, "rb") doesn't seem to work
body: Whenever I try to open a file in binary mode, `fopen()` returns `nullptr`, but `errno` is set to `0`.  I have verified that the file I'm opening exists and it opens just fine in text mode when I pass `"r"` instead of `"rb"`.

title: Allow building of tests in build_release script
body:
This adds the capability to build tests in the build_release script

You can do this by specifying a comma-separated list of directories (relative to /libraries/tests) of which tests to build.
- ex. `python build_release.py --build-tests=mbed,rtos/mbed`

This lets you build tests against all released platforms, which should make it easier to find linker errors quicker.

This is a necessary feature for CI.

title: [Export] Missing flags for Seeeduino Arch Pro in Emblocks project.
body:
Hello!
We have a small problem in platformio/platformio#508.
Looks like linker flags `-u _printf_float` and `-u _scanf_float` are missing in exported project for Emblocks, so `printf` doesn't work correctly with float values. Is this a bug?
Thanks!

title: [NUCLEO_F446RE] RTC+LSE+init
body: by default the RTC will start with the low speed external clock (LSE), the user may have the choice to use the low speed internal clock (LSI) if no LSE on board.

title: Changed target name from NZ32SC151 to NZ32_SC151

title: B96b serial async fix multiserial
body:
In case of app with 2 serial (using DMA) + 1 serial (stdio), we have found a bug. The dma handler is overwritten by the last initialized serial object.
Therefore read and write functions did not work anymore.
We have reworked this file to save 1 handler per UART IP, and align it with MBED OS file.
Tests have been passed. Same status as before (OK except MBED_37, manual test for SERIAL_ASYNC also OK)

title: uARM and ARM proposed changes
body:
https://developer.mbed.org/forum/mbed/topic/25940/

The next proposal I'd like to make is that there become a clear distinction about which targets use uARM and which use ARM (microlib versus standard library). **My suggestion is that any MCU with 64k or less flash use uARM (microlib) and any MCU with more than 64k use ARM (standard library)**. Feedback??

http://www.keil.com/support/man/docs/armlib/armlib_chr1358938937854.htm

title: Set -funsigned-char flag when exporting to GCC
WIZwiki-W7500 timing issues
body:
Hello!

I'm having issues performing correct timing for 1-Wire operations (such as reading a DS18B20 temperature sensor) on WIZwiki-W7500 platform. Other bitbanged protocols like the one in use for DHT11/22 sensors also seem to fail.

Take this code as example, since it explicits microseconds time delays: https://developer.mbed.org/forum/mbed/topic/101/?page=1#comment-829

On STM32 NUCLEO-F446RE and F303K8 it works just fine and the temperature is read correctly. Timing is also spot on, see this logic analyzer trace:

![screenshot from 2016-02-03 17 36 31](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13108002/12789206/2650edba-ca9d-11e5-9913-adb2f359faf1.png)

On WIZwiki-W7500 I can't really say the same:
![screenshot from 2016-02-03 17 38 52](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13108002/12789214/291a7124-ca9d-11e5-9105-780f9509c606.png)

Could this be related to the choice of `SystemCoreClock` and internal Xtal in #1237, which has not been fixed?

Thank you for your help.

title: STM32L476 Update rtc_api.c

Added RTC ISR check code for Mbed rtc_isenabled function.
Removed  rtc_inited parts.

Tested on Nucleo-L476 and Disco-L476 boards with and without vBat pin powered.
Also fully tested on prototype hardware.
Targets no longer resets RTC time registers on POR or nRST including sleep modes.

Reported here: https://developer.mbed.org/questions/63861/I2CTransfer-Function/?c=21233

We should improve the docs, users should be aware that async methods are not by default available , as for instance other methods (in this case could be sync methods).

title: Fix HSI configuration for STM32F0x.
[Silicon Labs] Fix support for the RC oscillator
body:
We were using the wrong defines for selecting the built-in RC oscillator's frequency, leading to it always configuring to 1MHz regardless of what was selected. Now fixed.

Additionally, fix for SPI pin selection.

title: Proposal to remove target support for GCC_CS  and GCC_CR
body:
I would like to submit a PR with some house cleaning. From what I've seen most current releases of Eclipse based IDEs are using GCC_ARM. Is anyone specifically using GCC_CS or GCC_CR and a current mbed lib release? If not I'd like to propose that we depreciate support for these as of Q1 2016. All releases for GCC would then consolidate on the GCC_ARM builds.

https://developer.mbed.org/questions/62188/Proposal-to-remove-target-support-for-GC/

title: Added SW4STM32 project exporter for stm32 targets
body: This commit adds project exporting to sw4stm32 IDE (http://www.openstm32.org/). Output of  `<python ./project.py -S>` with list of supported boards are in attached file [sw4stm32_supported_boards.txt](https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/files/100563/sw4stm32_supported_boards.txt)

title: [LPC11U68, LPC1549] Fixed PwmOut SCT Bugs
body:
Bug fixes related to issue #1510:
- Fixed period & pulse-width off-by-one errors
- Fixed 0% duty cycle output
- Improved duty cycle resolution at high frequencies

title: coupling between RTOS and STM32F4 stop mode
PwmOut broken on LPC11U68, LPC1549, possibly others
body: PwmOut is currently broken on the LPC11U68, LPC1549, and possibly other LPC targets using SCTs for PWM output. The period and pulsewidth are both off by 1, and the input clock is being scaled to 1MHz making high frequency output impossible. I'm currently investigating fixes for these issues.

title: STM32L4 InterruptIn has stopped working in Mbed-dev rev:58 Mbed rev: 112
body:
The title says it all.
The example:
https://developer.mbed.org/teams/ST/code/Nucleo_read_button_interrupt/?platform=ST-Nucleo-L476RG
no longer works, program freezes when button is pressed.
Noticed this on Mbed-dev rev:58 Mbed rev: 112, but may have broke before in previous revisions.

Currently working with Mbed-dev rev: 33

title: Adding Release_Canditate type and promote-build function to upload script
body: This patch introduces the idea of "Release Candidates". A build must begin as a Release Candidate, then based on the test results it can be promoted to a "Release" via the `promote-build` sub command.

title: [MAX32600MBED] Fixing a typo with the I2C pin names.
Update rtc_api.c
body:
Removed redundant RTC->CR define code + added RTC compensation code to allow calibration of the RTC.

Tom Russell found the RTC->CR settings in the rtc_api.c file overrode the OSC0->CR setting in system_MKL05Z4.c.
Effectively removing the internal loading capacitors for the external 32KHz crystal when the RTC is initialised.
If the external crystal 32Khz clock source is selected (default on the KL05), it is not necessary to call the RTC->CR functions. All other FRDM KLxx platforms RTC clock source is derived from the interface MCU.

Added RTC compensation function to allow calibration of the RTC.
This needs to be set in the rtc_init area, according to the manual, once the locks are enabled they can only be disabled with a POR or software reset making it difficult, probably impossible to place it in the user program code.

title: [Silicon Labs] Allow faster I2C baudrates
body: Added code to the I2C implementation to allow for SCK to go up to 1MHz (up from 100kHz previously)

title: [Silicon Labs] Fix regression towards older platforms
body:
The fix to have serial_api deal with NC pins for either RX or TX was only partly replicated into the code for older platforms, causing MBED_37 (serial_nc_rx) to fail. This has now been fixed by condensing code so that there is less room for copy-paste failures.

title: The predivider should be 2 here.
body:
Since we want to get a 48M PLLCLK when using HSI as resource and PLLMUL is 12 as it in current code, then we should set PREDIV to 2. If set the PREDIV to 1 as current code, the system clock is 96M.

 PLLCLK = 48 MHz ((HSI 8 MHz / 2) \* 12)
 PLLCLK = 96 MHz ((HSI 8 MHz / 1) \* 12)

title: Fixes toolchain filtering
body: Fixes an issue where build_release.py tries to build the mbed library for a platform with an unsupported toolchain

title: [Silicon Labs] Add support for the new EFM32 Pearl Gecko
body:
Rebased & opened a new pull request.

New release of the Silicon Labs HAL for mbed.
Changelog:
- Added HAL support for the new EFM32 Pearl Gecko kit
- Updated PWM implementation to be more in line with the expectations regarding how a PWM waveform should look
- Pulled up the included version of emlib to the latest (4.2.1)
- Code cleanup throughout the entire HAL
- Updated linker scripts to reflect the correct sizes for interrupt tables

title: [Silicon Labs] Add support for EFM32 Pearl Gecko
body:
New release of the Silicon Labs HAL for mbed.
Changelog:
- Added HAL support for the new EFM32 Pearl Gecko kit
- Updated PWM implementation to be more in line with the expectations regarding how a PWM waveform should look
- Pulled up the included version of emlib to the latest (4.2.1)
- Code cleanup throughout the entire HAL
- Updated linker scripts to reflect the correct sizes for interrupt tables

title: B fix #1480 : RTC not starting after soft reset
body:
We needed to change the location of the check of RTC_INITS flag after the PWR_CLK_ENABLE and LSE LSI oscillator configuration.
Only the HAL_RTC_ENABLE and HAL_RTC_Init are bypassed in case the RTC_INITS is already set.
This has been tested with MBED_16 test.
This fits also with the request of the issue #1403.

title: Allow buffer for RawSerial printf to be explicitly specified
body:
The buffer used for printf in RawSerial is either dynamically
allocated or used on the stack depending on the string size.
The buffer size should be user supplied instead.

title: Fix RawSerial when used with ARMCC microlib
body:
The function vsnprintf does not properly handle a size of zero for
the destination buffer, and will write data to it.  If the buffer is
set to null this will cause a hardfault.  This patch adds a workaround
for this bug by using a buffer of size 1.

title: [STM_F0]  Fix #1494  clock the APB2ENR_SYSCFGEN in RCC
body: Clocking APB2ENR_SYSCFGEN in RCC at system_init allows the SYSCFG->CFGR1 value to be taken into account during NVIC_SetVector

title: B96b serial flow control
body: Add serial control flow to the previous PR.

title: Simple program of NUCLEO_F030R8 dose not work.
Adding 'Release' build type
body: Adds 'Release' to the build types

title: Add target B96B_F446VE files
Added LPC1114 from RTC test exclude list
body: Disables the automated RTC test from running on the LPC1114 (since it doesn't have an RTC)

title: progen addition
Exporting to Atmel Studio
body:
```
$python project.py -m SAMD21G18A -i atmelstudio -p 27 -c
```

Using AS7 and the update wizard there is a problem with the generated projects if you click the 'migrate to current infrastructure' box. It adds an additional Device Startup folder causing duplicate symbols during linking

Appears to works OK with this box unchecked.

title: [MTS_DRAGONFLY_F411RE] Dragonfly pin updates
body: Correct incorrect serial pin names and add wakeup pin name.

title: Adding ProGen as default exporter for uvision4 and IAR
body:
Replace all iar/uvision4 templates by the project generator (https://github.com/project-generator/project_generator). This should fix #1464 - tracking issue for this feature.

I'll update progen version we depend on soon, as I release new version (need to add stlink support there for instance). For anyone testing, please use latest master for progen + progen definitions. Once I get the versions out, I'll update this PR.

I wrote a test script (warning - dirty, to quickly test if all targets are in progen definitions) to test if all our current uvision4 and IAR targets exports:

```
    'LPC11U68',
    # Removed as uvision4_lpc11u35_501.uvproj.tmpl is missing.

    'HRM1017',

    'ARCH_PRO',
    'ARCH_BLE',
    'DISCO_F407VG',
    'DISCO_L053C8',
    'DISCO_F334C8',
    'DISCO_F746NG',
    'MTS_GAMBIT',
    'ARCH_MAX',
    'MTS_MDOT_F405RG',
    'NRF51_DK',
    'NRF51_DONGLE',
    'SEEED_TINY_BLE',

    'DELTA_DFCM_NNN40',
    'MAXWSNENV',
    'MAX32600MBED',
    'MOTE_L152RC',
    'NZ32SC151',
]

proj_dict = {
    'common': {
    'sources': [''],
        'includes': [''],
        'target': [''],
        'tools_supported': ['iar_arm', 'uvision'],
        'output_type': ['exe'],
        'export_dir': 'generated_projects/{target}_{tool}'
    }
}

def main():
    logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)
    settings = ProjectSettings()
    for uvision_target in UVISION_TARGETS:
        proj_dict['common']['target'] = PROGEN_TARGETS[uvision_target]
        project = Project('project_1', [proj_dict], settings)
        if project.generate('uvision') != 0:
            loggin.error("Error exporting for uvision")
            return -1

    for iar_target in IAR_TARGETS:
        proj_dict['common']['target'] = PROGEN_TARGETS[iar_target]
        project = Project('project_1', [proj_dict], settings)
        if project.generate('iar_arm') != 0:
            loggin.error("Error exporting for iar")
            return -1

    logging.info("Exporting without error.")
    return 0

if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()
```

Please test anyone who is using uvision4 or IAR. Thanks!

title: LPC4337 stdio fixes for lpcxpresso board
Remove doubling of buffer size in realiseEndpoint()
body: realiseEndpoint() was unnecessarily allocating twice the buffer space for each endpoint buffer.  This was presumably for the sake of the hardware SIE's double-buffering (EVEN/ODD) system, but that's vestigial - this implementation doesn't use the double-buffering capability at all, leaving the ODDRST bit in the CTL register always set.  The double-size allocation is a pure waste of memory.

title: Fix interrupt handler for endpoints > 2
body: The IRQ handler calculated the endpoint number wrong when handling IN and OUT tokens.  The errant code worked by accident for endpoints 1 and 2 but was incorrect for other addresses.  For endpoints 5 and above it resulted in stray pointer read/writes that could crash the device.

title: STM32F4 RTC broken after soft reset - mbed lib rev 111
Fix nRF51 baud table size
body:
Increase the number of entries in the baud rate table from 17 to 18.
This problem was introduced in the patch:
0a6e345400e5e73eeb8df189bc3ce112f0dbd793 -
Add support for 56000 baud on nrf51

title: Support for microbit and microbit b processors with GNU tools for ARM Embeeded processors
body:
Hi,

In the current release of mbed, there is no support for microbit and microbit b processors for GNU tools for ARM Embedded processors.  Can it be possible to support both microbit processors with GNU tools for ARM Embedded processors at the earliest.

Regards,
Raghavendra

title: B96B_F446VE + NUCLEO_F446RE CAN API
body:
This pull request contains the CAN api for NUCLEO_F446RE and B96B_F446VE platforms.

(the branch dev_f4_asynch containted in PR #1470 was merged into this branch in order to get the code of the platform B96B_F446VE, because this previous PR was not yet merged)
